elements.title: Creative Vitality Summit
elements.subtitle: April 9 â€“ 10, 2024
elements.main_copy:
I'm in Boulder, Colorado this week where I'll be hosting a discussions of creativity in the era of AI at the Creative Vitalityâ„¢ Summit.
"What's that," you ask?
Now in its third year, the Creative Vitalityâ„¢ Summit will bring together artists, designers, technologists, arts advocates, and policy experts to consider the impact of new economic models, new forms of investment, and technological change in arts, culture, and the creative economy. Registration for this virtual event is free and is now open!

elements.link_text: Season 02 - Foresight & Innovation Experts From Industry
elements.title: Futures, Foresight & Innovation
elements.subtitle: Learn how futures and foresight practitioners do what they do, where they do it.
elements.main_copy: SuperSeminar is the opposite of things like TED, where you hear remarkable insights and perspectives from remarkable people â€” and don't get to engage in meaningful conversation with them. They're there..and then they're gone. SuperSeminar is not TED. It's a Salon-like discussion with two domain experts presenting short, incisive, evocative conversation starts â€” and then attendees and presenters engage in discussion. Limited seats. The value is in the opportunity for discussion.

elements.user_callout: In the ðŸŽ§-podcasts channel @Julian posted this
elements.post_copy: Listen to The Santiago Boys on Spotify. The Santiago Boys is a nine-part podcast about a group of radical utopians around Salvador Allende, Chile's socialist president. Undeterred by the Cold War and machinations of their enemies and aided by an eccentric British consultant, they try to wrestle control over technology from multinationals and intelligence agencies and use it to create a more egalitarian economy. As their dream gets crushed by Pinochet's bloody coup, the Santiago Boys find an unexpected afterlife - and in Silicon Valley of all places. The series is written and presented by Evgeny Morozov, a leading technology critic.

elements.name: Kevin NÃ¸rby Andersen
elements.subtitle: I design products and tools across bits and atoms that extend human ability to think and create through my design studio superultra.dk
elements.main_copy:
ðŸ§± An artifact you find interesting
I have a reproduction of a medical clay tablet from Sumeria, 2400 BCE. It's remarkable because it still contains its data after all these millennia and is beautifully ergonomic at the human scale, unlike the compact computers we carry in our hands

ðŸ“½ A film that has shaped or influenced who you are today
Blade Runner, 1982 Ridley Scott's Director's Cut: for its sci-fi objects and experiences, lighting and textures, and ultimately what it means to be human.

ðŸŽ§ A podcast worth listening to
Spark!

What else?
My father worked at NASA in Langley, Virginia, when NASA was established. He was a flight test engineer for the Mercury Mission and part of Gemini. He died at age 49. I have always been curious about his time at NASA. He was passionate about Sci-Fi, books, movies and shows. My mother often said that while watching Star Trek, he would comment on the mathematical possibilities of Star Trek creator Gene Roddenberry's inventions.

elements.title: Everything Everywhere All We Got
elements.subtitle: All the books. All the artifacts. All the cards.
elements.author: Julian
elements.main_copy:
So, I've put everything from the Near Future Laboratory Shop into one easy 25% off bundle. Look at all that stuff over there! All the books, including our latest artifact from the most likely alternative AI Android Future, Androids Dream of Electric Sheep and the collectors' card set. Of course, there are the best sellers as well â€” TBD Catalog, the product catalog that started all of this â€” and The Manual of Design Fiction and its 'part 2' 'It's Time To Imagine Harder'.

Everything Everywhere All We Got for 25% off!

Upon detecting an anomalous narrowband signal at 2296.481481 MHz the DSS tracking station supervisor initiated a comprehensive investigation. Collaborative analysis with White Sands Station and Guam confirmed the signal's non-terrestrial origin. The transmission was decoded with a narrator describing a mysterious entity referred to as 'The Box.' This report encapsulates the findings and ongoing inquiries into this unprecedented cosmic phenomenon, urging the scientific community to explore the intricate tapestry of space-time signals.
